intro: Tithymalus baxanicus, commonly known as the Baxan tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as cypsela. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
